poem:
Title: In The Shadow of Lincoln

Hardened soul, of granite and ink,
From the depths of history springs;
A man tempered by blood and clink,
Carves futures on freedom's wings.
Twisted threads of tales intertwine,
Circling 'round a ghost's fireplace.
Through Holzer's pen, Lincoln may shine,
Illuminating the human race.
In the crucible of their shared past,
The echo of a New World sings.
